title: Darius Q bug is the reason why he has such a high winrate!
body:
so I was lvl 2 and i got ganked, I then spammed my Q key to heal myself and hopefully escape from the gank then suddenly my Q got casted twice giving me a bunch of health back twice so 60% of missing health since i got them both time on the blade, after i escaped I see that the jungler and the laner I just Q'ed had 5 stacks on them even tho they should only have 2.

that may be the reason why his wr is that high.


 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=krq1xsXECDI&feature=youtu.be
There a video of the bug watch carefully in the slowmo end of the video at 14 seconds he gets healed 2 times


Edit: adding another video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rjea6jKdD24

Its kind of weird how bugs such as that get into live when they have a server specifically for testing them out..

A server that at this point is populated by the same people who read the changes and complain on the boards without actually trying it out.

The same People who thought Morde Bot lane would be horrible
The same people who thought Skarner's Update would be useless.

PBE players have been talking about this bug for a while, actually

People thought Morde would be terrible period, not because he's weak (his zones of power haven't really changed) but because his identity has been destroyed

The people that thought Skarner's update would be useless were right _at the time_. Then Riot buffed Skarner 3 times in a row over 3 consecutive PBE updates without even giving PBE players time to test each change individually. The Juggernaut patch went live shortly after.

And to be honest... Skarner hasn't really changed much... 
He is still the same ball of stat that runs at people and kill them by spamming Q

Though now his stun is quicker (one auto attack after landing E instead of needing to hit 3 abilities first) which does enable him to stun with his E and then quickly follow up with his R

Well, yeah. That's why PBE players thought the remake would be terrible. Skarner still has all of the same problems as before, bandaged with a ball of stats. Except that, like Ryze, he has moments where he's unstoppable (i.e. never 1v1 Ryze with his passive up, never 1v1 Skarner if he's near a shrine). Also, Riot added the Spire bonus whenever he uses R or stuns someone with E->Auto, which I feel was somewhat unnecessary.

I knew Skarner got the buff from procing the stun on his E.. but I didn't know he got it from his ult as well (not that it is the most useful while using ult as the attack speed buff can't be used with R as it disables auto attacks)

Riot added it to allow skarner to accesses the power of his passive without being in range of one of the spires.. well I think that was the idea (or if he is behind and the enemy controls the spires) 

(Well I suppose it also gives Skarner some more "counterplay" in that he loses a lot of his power if you are able to avoid his E)

Yeah, because outside of his Spires, Skarner is basically just old Skarner, but with less stats. xD

True, but remember he still gets bonus movement speed, making ult pulling into his own team a lot more reliable. Also, Skarner+Kalista is a thing (yes, Kalista can ult a Skarner that has ulted someone LOL)

Though his spires are pretty insane... 150% attack speed, 100 ms and almost infinite mana...

Or something else that can be fun Skarner + Nunu.. simply wait for someone to walk near Skarner then Nunu ults as Skarner pull them into Nunu's ult
(Works even better on TT because well removing 1/3 of the enemy players is better then 1/5 and there are usually more melee champions there and no wards)
Skarner -> Thresh Lantern is funny too, you should try it sometime =P

The reason people complained about Morde bot lane is because it's not what morde has been, what he should be(according to those who played him frequently), nor how he should work. It wasn't that it wouldn't be a strong pick, it was the forced change and identity/kit changes that was so irritating.

Also anyone who actually played skarner knew that he was stupid strong. Which was about half the people that posted on the PBE boards, but nobody listened to them.

I'm a PBE player, and I played the heck out of Mordekaiser on the PBE. I never said he was weak, but I thought that changing his identity was the worst idea they could implement for him. No one said he would be terrible... most people, including myself, are frustrated that he can only go bot lane to do well.
I'm pretty sure it's just for people like Brofresco to make money on youtube while also advertising the new stuff.
